column2: MS DMV PRACTICE TEST
column4: Mississippi

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text

column2: 1. When changing lanes, you should remember that:
column4: you should look over your left shoulder for a left lane change and yourÂ right shoulder for a right lane change.
column6: vehicles with two outside mirrors have no blind spots.
column8: You only need to turn and look over your right shoulder for lane changes to the right or left.

column2: 2. At intersections, crosswalks, and railroad crossings, drivers should always:
column4: stop, listen for oncoming traffic, and proceed with caution.
column6: slowly pass vehicles the vehicles ahead.
column8: look to the sides of their vehicle to see what is coming.

column2: 3. This road sign means:
column4: Vehicles turning left must make a U-turn.
column6: Drivers cannot make a complete turn to go in the opposite direction.
column8: Left turns are not allowed where this sign is displayed.

column2: 4. What is the main reason night driving is more difficult than daytime driving?
column4: The use of headlight is required by law.

column2: 5. This sign indicates the _______________ vehicles can safely travel in this area.
column4: suggested speed

column2: 6. If a tire suddenly blows out while you are driving, you should:
column4: slow down gradually and brake lightly.

column2: 7. A flashing red light:
column4: means the same thing as a stop sign.

column2: 8. Which of the following must you obey over the others?
column4: Police officer

column2: 9. This sign means:
column4: Vehicles may only turn left.
column6: The center lane is shared for left turns.
column8: Left turns in both directions of travel are not permitted.

column2: 10. This sign indicates:
column4: The road may be slippery when wet. Drive slowly.

column2: 11. Are drivers allowed to exceed the speed limit to pass other vehicles?
column4: Yes, but only by 10 MPH or less.
column6: Yes, but only if they drive with caution.

column2: 12. In bad weather conditions, when visibility is low, drivers should:
column4: drive in the lane closest to oncoming traffic.
column6: speed up to get off the road quickly.

column2: 13. What does this sign indicate?
column4: Parallel railroad crossing (crossroad)

column2: 14. This road sign means:
column4: Steep grade ahead
column8: The road ahead curves right, then left

column2: 15. Drivers can not pass a vehicle on the left if:
column4: they can not safely return to the right lane before any oncoming vehicle comes within 200 feet of them.
column6: their lane has a solid yellow center line.

column2: 16. __________________ is a safe driving technique.
column4: Starring at the road ahead of your vehicle
column8: Using your high beam lights in the fog

column2: 17. You may drive faster than the posted speed limit:
column4: Under no circumstances.
column8: when passing another vehicle, as long as it is safe to do so.

column2: 18. Traffic lights are normally ____________ from the top to bottom or left to right.
column4: red, yellow and green

column2: 19. Only _____ can reduce the alcohol level in the blood.
column4: drinking coffee

column2: 20. At a red traffic light with a green arrow, you may proceed in the direction of the arrow:
column4: if you are in the proper lane and the roadway is clear.
column6: after making a complete stop first.
column8: if you wait until the light changes.

column2: 21. The golden rule of driving is to:
column4: treat others the way you want to be treated.
column6: put on your emergency flashers when driving at night.
column8: drive faster than the vehicle behind you.

column2: 22. If a pedestrian is illegal crossing in the middle of the street (not at a crosswalk) you:
column4: should increase your speed, honk your horn and proceed.
column6: do not have to stop for them.

column2: 23. This road sign means:
column4: Stop

column2: 24. If you are blinded by headlights on an approaching vehicle, you should:
column4: move your eyes to the right.
column6: flash your headlights to high beam for a second, then return to low beam.

column2: 25. Drivers may need more space in front of their vehicle:
column4: when following motorcycles.
column6: when carrying a heavy load or pulling a trailer.

column2: 26. This road sign means:
column4: Bicycles are not allowed in this area

column2: 27. In case of skidding, drivers should NOT:
column4: tap the gas pedal with their foot.
column6: pump the brakes gently if they are about to hit something.
column8: take their foot off the gas pedal.

column2: 28. This sign indicates:
column4: Winding road

column2: 29. Who is most at risk?
column4: Drivers who have overslept.
column8: Drivers who are driving long distances without rest breaks.

column2: 30. The driver of an emergency vehicle that uses lights and a siren can legally:
column4: exceed the speed limit
